discussion.content: SNAT, you can tell based on the way the arrow is pointing. the translation also occurs at the source indicated by the same blue color used for the text and the t1 router where the snat takes place

questions.question_text: Which CLI command does an NSX administrator run on the NSX Manager to generate support bundle logs if the NSX UI is inaccessible?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Without NSX,
all application network traffic must traverse a physical firewall to be
segmented, even when residing on the same physical server. With NSX,
application network traffic can be efficiently isolated via microsegmentation, regardless of its physical location or underlying network
topology. NSX micro-segmentation provides a foundational
architectural shift to enable topology agnostic, distributed security
services to applications in the evolving data center.

Selected Answer: B
One key feature of NSX Intelligence is its ability to provide recommendations for micro-segmentation policies based on network traffic data. 
https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwijjcKqnvKFAxVynP0HHeo9Bf0QFnoECBkQAw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vmware.com%2Fcontent%2Fdam%2Fdigitalmarketing%2Fvmware%2Fen%2Fpdf%2Fproducts%2Fnsx%2Fvmware-nsx-microsegmentation.pdf&usg=AOvVaw0tpf3V6po5vYeKoF2XgD64&opi=89978449

Selected Answer: A
Network Segmentation is not a "feature" of NSX. DFW would be the feature you'd be using to implement microseg.
Virtual Security Zones are a "feature" of NSX IDS/IPS so must be the correct response

questions.question_text: NSX improves the security of today's modern workloads by preventing lateral movement, which feature of NSX can be used to achieve this?
